comments: POW is a measure of platelet anisocyiosis & plaqueletcnt-and is indicative of the volume of circulating plaielets in a unit volume of blood.
This test is useful in distinguishing Essential Thrombocythemia (Pow increased) from Reactive Thrombocyrosis (Pow normal).

Interpretation: POW % Interpretation Lower than normal range: may indicate iron or B12 deficiency, bone marrow disorders, 9.0 - 17.0 Normal range: indicates a normal variation in the size of plaielets in the bloxi Higher than normal range: may indicate liver disease, bone marrow disorders, or immune thrombocytopenia
